title: need to make sure outputDir in config has "/" at the end
body: need to check and add that in the workflow

title: Reference access permission and GRCh38
body:
Hi Wendy,

I got a permission error when I try to access: /scratch/GEMSCAN_tutorial/hg19/. Also, could you put a GRCh38 reference file there too?

Thanks!

title: allow user to use cram files as input
body: currently the pipeline assumes that the input alignment file is bam and infers the bam file index as <bamfile>.bai, change the sample.txt input format to allow the user to input the index file name should allow cram files to be used.

title: Test using glnexus merge to merge HaploytypeCaller gvcf files (instead of combineGVCFs)
body:
- whether it's faster (tested on GIAB exome samples and seems to be much faster)
- whether the performance is comparable

title: Which vcf/gvcf files to keep?
body:
Strelka2 and DeepVariant produce both vcf and gvcf files for each sample and currently, both are kept. Is it necessary to keep both or just the per sample gvcf files is enough?

GATK Haplotyper produces gvcf files and they are genotyped into vcf files, currently the gvcf files are marked as temp.
If we do switch to using GLnexus merge for GATK Haplotype caller we may want to keep the per sample gvcf files for future merging.

title: check for valid bed file before running the pipeline
body: check to make sure the bed file is sorted without overlapping regions before running the pipeline

title: add checks to make sure the samples.txt file is tab delimited
body: otherwise the use may get errors like "AttributeError: 'float' object has no attribute 'startswith'"

title: bebops docker image causes "kernel too old" error in CCAD
body: create ubuntu 16 docker image for bedtops

title: runtime not properly mapped in ccad profile
body: needs to be converted to the number of minutes like in the biowulf profile

title: Non-clickable link in user document
body: The user document "Running_on_NIH_Biowulf" section, "create config/samples.txt and config/config.yaml as described in **here**", The "here" is not clickable because it will move to next line when mouse over it.

title: Have option to specify number of cpus by rule in CCAD
bedtools validation only check  to make sure the bedfile is sorted
make GLnexus memory limit slightly less than glnexus_memGB
body: It seems that GLnexus memory usage is sometimes higher than the limit specified

title: make bed file (and gzipped bed file) optional
body: gzip the bed file as part of the preprocessing workflow

title: increase default wall time for slurm config
body: the default queue wall time may not be sufficient for some of the rules

title: create conda wrapper for GLnexus merge
body: so that the code isn't repeated for each caller

title: add  time limit and multithreading to norm_left_align_split rules
add support for remote files on object store as input on Biowulf
body: This has been tested with google storage, the current issue is that if we download the data from the object storage, and if we are parallelizing by chromosome, each job downloads to the same location and causing conflicts.

title: HaplotypeCaller bySample option error at HC_create_each_sample_manifest
body:
if by_chrom is set to FALSE, the workflow generates
MissingInputException: Missing input files for rule HC_create_each_sample_manifest:

title: set default path to glnexus_strelka2_config
body: so that the users do not have to set it if they aren't specifying a custom glnexus config for strelka2

title: write a script to generate the samples.txt from a directory with BAM/cram files
body: so that the users don't have to generate this by hand

title: handle alternate contigs and scaffolds in bed file
body:
currently, glnexus merge takes the user inputted bed file, for the merge, which may contain alternative contigs and scaffolds, this would cause the procedure to fail with error:
Failed to parse the bed file: Invalid: Unknown contig

We may add to the documentation to use a "clean" bed file, or do some initial processing at the beginning of the workflow to keep only the desired chromosomes/contigs.

title: when sampleID in samples.txt is an integer the workflow fails
body: this is because the read_samplesFile() function uses read_table() from pandas to read in samples.txt and the default would take sampleID as integer, which causes issues downstream.

title: GLnexus merge memory requirements calculation
body: Look into calculating GLnexus merge memory requirements, figure out the relationship with sample size

title: fixing the symlinks in strelka2_AddSampleName rule
body:
mv the file to create filenames with sample names may cause confusion to the workflow when the workflow is interrupted. 
I think removing the symlinks should solve this issue and will look into it

title: prepend_labels for strelka calls runs longer than 2 hours
body:
User reported that prepend_labels for strelka calls runs longer than 2 hours
would be good to estimate the time needed from the number of samples and the number of variants (WGS/WES)

title: move Docker registry from quay.io to ghcr.io
body: quay.io is bought by redhat and no longer free. will move the docker registry to GitHub packages and recreate the CI/CD workflow.

title: The workflow skips many steps if the bed file contains only 1 line
body: The workflow skips many steps (and start aggregating variants even calling them) if the bed file contains only 1 line. Temporary solution would be requiring the bed file to contain at least 2 regions. Need to look into how to make sure the workflow is constructed correctly with only 1 line in the bed file

title: implement Harmonize mode only
body: Implement harmonize mode only , so that the user can specify the raw VCF files from each caller and the workflow returns the merged VCF

title: some docker images are out of date
body: When the workflow was run, singularity is having trouble pulling the docker image. Updating it may fix the issue.

title: temp directory is having issues
body: using the param option, Snakemake is unable to create the directory. using an existing directory for bcftools sort temporary directory instead.
